conversation.content: Oh great, um, so I've got a real fun situation here with an invoice that's, uh, basically being held hostage by feuding neighbors.
Okay so, um, let me just... pull up your account here and, uh, that's definitely... not something I hear every day... What's your order number if you have it?
FNC-4491-BB2. Install was Tuesday but neither neighbor will sign off because they're, um, apparently in some kind of property line war.
Right so, uh, I've got FNC-4491-BB2 here and I can see the, um... the install is marked as pending completion... which is... hmm... Let me check the notes because that's...
Yeah, pending. Forever pending. I literally installed a fence through, er, what might be a divorce? I don't even know anymore.
Oh that's... I mean, um, according to what I'm seeing here in ticket TKT-88429-X, you need, uh, both property owners to sign the completion form? And neither one will...
Bingo. Mrs. Henderson says it's two inches on her side, Mr. Henderson says, um, it's exactly where he wanted it, and I'm just...
That's really, um, putting you in a tough spot. So, uh, normally I'd just... but with dispute code DSP-7764 attached, I can't, er, release the payment until...
Until what, world peace? Um, look, I installed exactly where the survey marks showed, like, I've got photos and everything.
No no, I totally get it. Let me, um, see what options... Hmm, there's this escalation path EXC-3399-L but it needs, uh, third party verification which...
Which sounds expensive and, uh, time-consuming and honestly? I just want to get paid for the fence I already built, you know?
Right right. I really, um, wish I could just... override this but the system won't... Hold on though, what if we, uh, reclassify this under provision code PRV-6622-M?
Is that, um, is that actually a thing or are you just making up numbers to make me feel better?
No it's, uh, it's real! See, if we mark it as a, um, partial completion with documented dispute... not between you and them but between them... that might actually...
Oh so like, I'm not the problem, they're each other's problem? That's, er, that's actually pretty accurate.
Exactly! Um, let me just, uh, try to... okay so under case file CSE-9983-QR2, I'm adding your documentation and... hmm, it's asking for a supervisor approval but...
But nothing ever gets approved on Fridays, right? That's how this always goes.
Well, um, actually my supervisor is... she's pretty good about these and, uh, especially with verification photos... Can you email those to disputes@fencing with reference REF-7724-NK9?
Already sending them. Um, you've been weirdly helpful for someone who kept saying they couldn't help. Like, thanks for actually trying here.
I mean, um, I hate when people get stuck because of... stuff that's not even their fault, you know? Check back Monday, uh, with ticket TKT-88429-X and it should be... fingers crossed... resolved.

scenario: fence installer, caught in the middle of a neighbor dispute that's affecting his invoice
